column5: Abu Garcia Vendetta Spinning & Casting Rods, Priced at $79.99-$84.99 http://www.basspro.com/webapp/wcs/stores/s...__SearchResults http://www.basspro.com/webapp/wcs/stores/s...OSSSELL_PRODUCT  Just was browsing today looking at some new stuff and both these and the Falcon BoCoo rods were new and exciting looking  Vendetta   Falcon BuCoo Spinning & Casting Rods, Priced at $99.99-$109.99 http://www.basspro.com/webapp/wcs/stores/s...__SearchResults http://www.basspro.com/webapp/wcs/stores/s...__SearchResults  BuCoo    Thanks for viewing, just looking into the "foam" series of rods more for a light weight for for crankbaits. Any BPS guys know if they are on sale in Vaughan?  MTBF
I hate those split grips..  Gimme cork.
Was at BPS yesterday looking for a few rods, lucky I didn't buy, didn't see those though.  EDIT: Just called Bass Pro, they don't have those rods and will not be carrying them at all.
they are wild looking but i wonder if the appearance isn't more for appearance than it is for function...  and i agree with bill, i will never buy a rod without cork.

mike, I've been looking at the Vendetta really hard...It looks like an awesome rod to me One concern is that the guides are questionable, so I will wait until around next bass opener before I go get a new rod.. And I think you'll have to order that rod online to get it..Or drive to the states.  I'll PM you a link you should look at regarding the quality and build of the rod.
Apparently Le Baron should be carrying them.  No details yet though.
The Abu is sexy.. but i got a thing for black and red stuff, lol

When you live 30 minutes from Shimano Canada, and when Shimano has every rod at every price point that you could ever want, why would you invest in something that will be a warranty nightmare if you ever need service?
